question: Describe symptoms of the Visual snow syndrome.
ideal_answer: Visual snow (VS) is a constant visual disturbance described as flickering dots occupying the entire visual field. Recently, it was characterized as the defining feature of a VS syndrome (VSS), which includes palinopsia, photophobia, photopsias, entoptic phenomena, nyctalopia, and tinnitus.

BACKGROUND: Visual snow is a persistent visual disturbance characterized by rapid flickering dots throughout the visual field.
RECENT FINDINGS: Visual snow is a condition where patients see constant, innumerable flickering dots throughout the visual field, similar to "TV static."
